title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 123.3 - Timelines
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 123.3 - Timelines

State Regulations
(a) Boards of
education must commit, via resolution, to eliminating use of all Indigenous
names, logos, and mascots by the end of the 2022-23 school year. Such
resolution shall identify a plan to eliminate all use of the prohibited name, logo, or mascot within a reasonable time, which shall be no later than the end
of the 2024-2025 school year. (b) Upon a showing of good cause, the commissioner may grant an extension of the
timelines prescribed in subdivision (a) of this section. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
123.3

Adopted

New

York State Register May 3, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 18, eff. 5/3/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
